summary: Country music, also known as country and western, started in the southern U.S. in the 1920s. It tells stories about everyday American life, especially working-class people. This genre is recognized for its simple songs, folk-inspired lyrics, and instruments like banjos, fiddles, and guitars. Originally called "hillbilly music," it later merged with western music and became popular in the 1940s. Today, country music remains one of the most-listened-to genres during commute hours in the United States.
title: Country music
